required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pressure Therapy in the Treatment of Upper Arm of Cerebral Palsy Children
clinical_study.official_title: Pressure Therapy in the Treatment of Upper Arm of Cerebral Palsy Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of a 6 months upper arm proprioceptive pressure therapy on Assisting Hand Assessment ("AHA") performance in Cerebral Palsy (CP). To perform this study, 80 CP patients aged of 5 to 10 years old will be included in a multicentric, double blind, prospective parallel-group randomized study. Treatment will be a pressure therapy using a LYCRA® compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy. Primary outcome is to increase of 60% of AHA performance. The secondary outcome are to increase Quality of Upper Extremity Skill Test (QUEST), quality of life and improve Somatosensory Evoked Potentials (SEP).

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of a 6 months upper arm proprioceptive pressure therapy on Assisting Hand Assessment ("AHA") performance in Cerebral Palsy (CP). To perform this study, 80 CP patients aged of 5 to 10 years old will be included in a multicentric, double blind, prospective parallel-group randomized study. Treatment will be a pressure therapy using a LYCRA® compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy. Primary outcome is to increase of 60% of AHA performance. The secondary outcome are to increase Quality of Upper Extremity Skill Test (QUEST), quality of life and improve Somatosensory Evoked Potentials (SEP)

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Assisting Hand Assessment performance is a functional test to assess hand function for children with unilateral upper limb disabilities.

secondary_outcome.description: Upper Extremity skill Test is a functional test to assess upper limb mobility for children with unilateral upper limb disabilities.
Somatosensory Evoked Potentials (SEP) is a functional test to assess sensory nerve conduction

arm_group.description: Proprioceptive pressure therapy using a a LYCRA® compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy : 15 to 25 mmHg.
LYCRA® non-compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy : < 5 mmHg.

intervention.description: Proprioceptive pressure therapy using a a LYCRA® compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy : 15 to 25 mmHg.
intervention.other_name: Proprioceptive pressure therapy by Medical Z

intervention.description: LYCRA® non-compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy : < 5 mmHg.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children with upper limb with pre/peri birth etiologic CP.
- Children aged 5 to 10 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children with language dysfunction
- LYCRA® allergia
- Botulic Toxin injection on upper limb 4 month before inclusion

overall_official.affiliation: Centre Marc Sautelet, Villeneuve d'Ascq, France

facility.name: Service d'Education et de Soins Spécialisés à domicile_APF de Creil
Centre de Soins de Suite et de Réadaptation Pédiatrique Spécialisé_Centre Paul Dottin
